FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/compression_cal.py

  • Contain source code for counting number of parameters and number of flops in model.

  • Code is modified from https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/33992733

Version: 1.0

utils.compression_cal.print_model_parm_flops(net, imagenet=False)

Counting number of parameters in the model

Parameters:

  • net – the model to be calculated for parameters and flops

  • imagenet – which dataset is used

utils.compression_cal.print_model_parm_nums(net)

Counting number of parameters in the model

Parameters:

net – model to print param_num

FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/load_data.py

  • Contain source code for loading data.

Version: 1.0

utils.load_data.load_cifar100(is_train=True, batch_size=128)

Load cifar-100 datasets.

Parameters:

  • is_train – if true, load train_test/val data; else load test data.

  • batch_size – batch_size of train_test data

Returns:

loader: training loader or test loader

utils.load_data.load_imagenet(is_train=True, batch_size=128)

Load imagenet datasets.

Parameters:

  • is_train – if true, load train_test/val data; else load test data.

  • batch_size – batch_size of train_test data

Returns:

(train_loader, valid_loader): training loader, and validation loader

utils.load_data.load_svhn(is_train=True, batch_size=128)

Load SVHN datasets.

Parameters:

  • is_train – if true, load train_test/val data; else load test data.

  • batch_size – batch_size of train_test data

Returns:

loader: training loader or test loader

FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/lr_decay.py

  • Contain source code for updating learning rate.

Version: 1.0

utils.lr_decay.adjust_lr(learning_rate, lrd=10, log=None)

Update learning rate.

Parameters:

  • learning_rate – original learning rate.

  • lrd – decrease ratio of learning rate.

  • log – if log is not None, print the comments for changing learning rate.

Return lr:

adjusted learning rate.

FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/optimizer_option.py

  • Contain source code for choosing optimizer.

Version: 1.0

utils.optimizer_option.get_optimizer(net, learning_rate, optimizer='SGD', weight_decay=0.0001, momentum=0.9)

Get optimizer accroding to arguments.

There are four optimizers, SGD, Adagrad, Adam, and RMSprop. :param net: the model :param learning_rate: learing rate :param optimizer: choose an optimizer - SGD/Adagrad/Adam/RMSprop :param weight_decay: weight decay rate :param momentum: momentum of the optimizer

Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more contributor license agreements. See the NOTICE file distributed with this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership. FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/save_restore.py

  • Contain source code for saving and restoring the model.

Version: 1.0

utils.save_restore.create_log(args)

Save the training process.

Parameters:

args – arguments of the trained model

Returns:

open: open file

utils.save_restore.init_with_alpha_resnet(source_net, dest_net, alpha)

Initialize with width multiplier for resnet.

Parameters:

  • source_net – a base model

  • dest_net – a model to be compressed

  • alpha – width multiplier. if alpha is less than 1, a part of standard convolution kernel is used for initializing kernels of FALCON.

  • dest_net – a model to be compressed

utils.save_restore.init_with_alpha_vgg(source_net, dest_net, alpha)

Initialize with width multiplier for vgg.

Parameters:

  • source_net – a base model

  • dest_net – a model to be compressed

  • alpha – width multiplier. if alpha is less than 1, a part of standard convolution kernel is used for initializing kernels of FALCON.

  • dest_net – a model to be compressed

utils.save_restore.load_model(net, args)

Restore the pre-trained model.

Parameters:

  • net – model architecture without parameters

  • args – arguments of the trained model

utils.save_restore.load_specific_model(net, args, convolution='', input_path='')

Restore the pre-trained model.

Parameters:

  • net – model architecture without parameters

  • args – arguments for a current model

  • convolution – kinds of convolution

  • input_path – path of a stored model

utils.save_restore.mkdir(path)

Make a directory if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

path – directory path

utils.save_restore.save_model(best, args, log)

Save the trained model.

Parameters:

  • best – best trained model (to be saved)

  • args – arguments of the trained model

utils.save_restore.save_specific_model(best, args, convolution='')

Save the trained model.

Parameters:

  • best – best trained model (to be saved)

  • args – arguments for the trained model

FALCON: Lightweight and Accurate Convolution

File: utils/timer.py

  • Contain source code for a timer.

  • Code is got from

https://dev.tencent.com/u/zzpu/p/yolov2/git/raw/ 4b2c6c7df1876363aba3bbd600aa68e4deeb4487/utils/timer.py

Version: 1.0

class utils.timer.Timer

A simple timer.

tic()

Start timer.

toc(average=True)

Stop timer.

Parameters:

average – whether to calculate the average time or not

Returns:

average_time: average time
